newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT-Telesp maintained as a buy.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT-Telesp maintained as a buy.

text.p: -- Local bank Banco Patrimonio, an associate of Salomon Brothers, reiterated its buy recommendation on shares of telecommunications firm Telesp, a unit of Brazilian telecom giant Telebras serving Sao Paulo state.
-- It kept the rating in view of Telesp's "superior efficiency level and improved margins, as well as attractive market outlook," it said.
-- Patrimonio also said it raised earnings estimates for the firm to $729 million from $649.6 million for 1996 and to $935.1 million from $909.2 million for 1997.
-- In a report, the bank cited Telesp's strong second quarter earnings of $215.2 million, raising to $396.2 million its first half earnings. (Figures are not inflation-adjusted.)
-- The result is mainly due to higher rates and increased traffic as well as a 9.5 percent year-to-year growth in conventional lines and 63 percent growth in cellular numbers.
-- Telesp preferred was off 2.50 reais at 192.00 reais and its voting common was down 4.50 reais at 167.50 reais at 1405 local time/1702 GMT on the Sao Paulo bourse.
